data.title: Lion (One of a Pair, South Pedestal)

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of bronze with green patina.

data.artist_display:
Edward Kemeys
American, 1843–1907
American Bronze Founding Company
Chicago
data.inscriptions: Lion on south side of AIC signed, left front: "Kemeys / 1893"
data.publication_history: Art Institute of Chicago, Annual Report (1893), 5. Jane H. Clark, "The Art Institute's Guardian Lions," Art Institute of Chicago Museum Studies 14, 1 (1988), 46–55, 102–103. Steve Johnson, "Masks Up: Art Institute Lions, Daley Center Picasso Get Coronavirus Face Coverings," The Chicago Tribune, last modified Apr 30, 2020, https://www.chicagotribune.com/coronavirus/ct-ent-picasso-art-institute-lions-masks-coronavirus-0501-20200430-2deny3agqzeehlltube7gie6na-story.html (ill.). Mack Liederman, "Art Institute Lions Being Removed for Cleaning, But Don't Worry—They'll Be Back," Block Club Chicago, June 10, 2022, https://blockclubchicago.org/2022/06/10/art-institute-lions-being-removed-for-cleaning-but-dont-worry-theyll-be-back (ill). Carole Kuhrt Brewer, "Art Institute of Chicago's iconic lions are taking a short leave from their Michigan Avenue watch," ChicagoNow.com, June 10, 2022, https://www.chicagonow.com/show-me-chicago/2022/06/art-institute-of-chicagos-iconic-lions-are-taking-a-short-leave-from-their-michigan-avenue-watch (ill.). Roseanne Tellez, "Art Institute lions to be deep-cleaned for first time in 21 years," Fox 32 Chicago, June 13, 2022, https://www.fox32chicago.com/news/art-institute-lions-to-be-cleaned-for-first-time-in-21-years (ill.). Stefano Esposito, "Art Institute's famous lions head out for a deep cleaning," Chicago Sun-Times, June 14, 2022, https://chicago.suntimes.com/entertainment-and-culture/2022/6/14/23167678/art-institute-chicago-lions-removed-deep-cleaning-preservation (ill.). "Art Institute lions, symbols of Chicago, get some needed TLC," Chicago Sun-Times, June 14, 2022, https://chicago.suntimes.com/2022/6/14/23167215/art-institute-lions-symbols-of-chicago-get-some-needed-care-editorial (ill.). "Chicago Art Institute's Iconic Lions Taken Down for Deep Cleaning, Officials Say," NBC Chicago, June 14, 2022, https://www.nbcchicago.com/news/local/chicago-art-institutes-iconic-lions-taken-down-for-deep-cleaning-officials-say/2857440 (ill.). Jake Sheridan, "Art Institute lions head for a steam and a wax, Field Museum dino goes to dumpster," Chicago Tribune, June 14, 2022, https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/breaking/ct-art-institute-lions-field-institute-dinosaur-down-20220614-2nkekpcun5exdea7hjcvgbk44q-story.html (ill.). Hannah Su, "On Hiatus: The Art Institute of Chicago's iconic lions go on vacation," The Architect's Newspaper, June 15, 2022, https://www.archpaper.com/2022/06/the-art-institute-chicago-lions-vacation (ill.). Kelly Bauer and Mack Liederman, "Art Institute's Lions Spotted on the Highway After Being Taken Away To Be Cleaned," Block Club Chicago, June 15, 2022, https://blockclubchicago.org/2022/06/15/art-institutes-lions-spotted-on-the-highway-after-being-taken-away-to-be-cleaned (ill.).
